title: How to Delete Spotify Playlists (And Remove Playlists You Didn’t Create)

steps.title: Open Spotify on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open Spotify on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Tap the app icon that looks like black soundwaves on a green background.

steps.title: Tap Your Library.
steps.content: Tap Your Library . You'll see this at the bottom of your screen next to an icon of some shelved books.

steps.title: Tap the playlist that you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap the playlist that you want to delete. When you open the playlist, you’ll see the tracks that you've added to the playlist. If you can’t find your playlist, tap Playlists at the top of the app screen.

steps.title: Tap ⋮ (Android) or ••• (iOS).
steps.content: Tap ⋮ (Android) or ••• (iOS). You'll see this three-dot icon to the right of (or below) the playlist's name. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete Playlist.
steps.content: Tap Delete Playlist . The “Delete” button is next to an icon of an X or - , depending on your platform. [2] X Research source Tap Delete. If you see a pop-up notification to confirm your choice, select “yes” to finish deleting the playlist.

steps.title: Open Spotify on your desktop.
steps.content: Open Spotify on your desktop. Click the app icon that looks like black soundwaves on a green background. If you don’t have the Spotify app on your computer, open your preferred internet browser and navigate to the Spotify web player to delete playlists from Spotify.

steps.title: Click the playlist that you want to delete.
steps.content: Click the playlist that you want to delete. Find all of your Spotify playlists in the left panel on your screen. Double-click on the playlist to open it.

steps.title: Click ••• .
steps.content: Click ••• . Find this three-dot menu icon at the top of your playlist. Double-click the button to view a drop-down menu of options. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . Select the “Delete” option near the bottom of the drop-down menu. I you see a pop-up notification to confirm your request, tap Delete to complete the process. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open Spotify on your computer.
steps.content: Open Spotify on your computer. Spotify doesn’t have a feature to delete all playlists at once on the mobile app, so you’ll need to use the computer client on Mac or Windows.

steps.title: Create a new playlist folder.
steps.content: Create a new playlist folder. Next to "Your Library," click the + icon and select Create a playlist folder . [5] X Research source You can also press Ctrl + Shift + N (Windows) or Cmd + Shift + N (Mac) to create a playlist folder.

steps.title: Drag all the playlists you want to delete into the folder.
steps.content: Drag all the playlists you want to delete into the folder. Use your mouse to drag and drop each to-be-deleted playlist into the folder. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click the folder the folder and select Delete.
steps.content: Right-click the folder the folder and select Delete . Every playlist in that folder will be deleted!

steps.title: Open Spotify.
steps.content: Open Spotify. This method works the same whether you’re on the computer, web player, or mobile app.

steps.title: Click or tap Your Library.
steps.content: Click or tap Your Library . If you’re on the mobile app, find the Your Library button at the bottom of your screen next to an icon of some shelved books. If you’re on a desktop, look for your library in the left part of the screen.

steps.title: Click or tap the Playlists tab.
steps.content: Click or tap the Playlists tab. The Playlists tab is always at the top of your screen. Clicking this tab will show you only playlists in your library and filter out other types of media.

steps.title: Click or tap the playlist you want to unfollow.
steps.content: Click or tap the playlist you want to unfollow. It will open and show you which songs it contains. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click or tap the green checkmark.
steps.content: Click or tap the green checkmark. The green circle with a checkmark will turn into a black-and-white plus sign. This playlist will no longer appear in your library and it will no longer be available for you to listen to offline. This method is for playlists that you didn’t make yourself, which is why you can’t delete them. Instead, you have to unfollow the playlists according to this set of steps. The playlist will still exist, so you can follow it again if you choose to in the future.

steps.title: Log in to your Spotify account page on a desktop computer.
steps.content: Log in to your Spotify account page on a desktop computer. Open the Spotify Web Player and click the small icon with your first initial in it. A dropdown menu will open—select Account from this menu. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click "Recover playlists."
steps.content: Click "Recover playlists ." On your Spotify account page , scroll down until you see Recover playlists next to a circular arrow icon. Click this text to see a page with all of your recently deleted playlists. Keep in mind that you can only recover a Spotify playlist within 90 days of it being deleted. Only recently-deleted playlists will be found on this page—otherwise, you won’t be able to get your deleted playlist back. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click "Restore" next to the playlist you want to recover.
steps.content: Click "Restore" next to the playlist you want to recover. Browse through your list of recently-deleted playlists until you find the one you accidentally deleted. Select the Restore button on the right side of the screen. The playlist is now restored and will reappear in your Spotify library. [10] X Research source
